name: Auto-roster initial setup greeting
body:
Hi ,

My name is %name% and I will be helping to support your auto-roster integration.
​​​​​​​
Please let me know if you have questions. I will be happy to help!


Name

Customer Support Engineer
E-mail:
Phone:
Website: www.ixl.com

name: MDM Template for Roland
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: If you have any questions concerning this configuration settings, please let me know and I’ll be happy to help!

name: FTP Enabled
body:
I have enabled the Auto-Roster integration for your account. This will trigger an e-mail to you from our system with the SFTP connection information.

Please let me know when you have uploaded your first set of files, and I will audit them along with a member of our development team. I will communicate to you any issues with the data that will prevent a successful first sync.

Once the data has been audited, our development team will perform the first sync in accordance with the preferences you have sent me.

After that, our nightly sync service will process your uploaded files nightly at midnight, eastern time. Any files received before that time will be applied to your account.

Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help.

name: AR Enabled kickoff 4
body:
Thank you very much for getting back to me. I have enabled the Auto-Rostering integration for your IXL account.

You may upload your Auto-Roster data to our SFTP site using the following information to connect:

URL: sftp.ixl.com, port 22
Username:
Password: The SFTP key sent in a secure message by e-mail to you at

After you have uploaded the initial set of data, I will audit the data along with a member of our development team. I will communicate any issues with the data to you.

Once we have reviewed the data, our development team will manually perform the first Auto-Roster sync in accordance with your preferences.

After the first sync, our nightly processor will run every night at midnight, eastern time. Any data uploaded before that time will be processed and synced to your account.

​Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.

name: failed_by_num_changes summer
body:
My name is Roland Estrada, and I am the support engineer for IXL's Auto-Rostering feature.

Our nightly sync service detected a large number of changes were made to your uploaded CSV files. As a precaution, we do not automatically process files that will cause greater than 10% changes to your IXL account.

These changes are from students being added or removed from the student roster, or for grade level changes for existing students.

If these changes are intended, please let me know and I would be happy to process the roster sync for your account.

Additionally, as many schools move into the new school year, I wanted to make you aware of some additional options available to you for your IXL data. These options will help your IXL account more closely match the data from your SIS, and will clean up previous years' teacher rosters.

At your request, IXL can:
  • Remove any students not uploaded via Auto-Rostering
  • Remove any teachers not uploaded via Auto-Rostering
  • Archive teacher rosters for any teachers created via Auto-Rostering
Please let me know if you would like me to process the roster changes on your account, as well as your preference for those additional options.

name: failed_by_num_changes grade level
body:
My name is Roland Estrada, and I am the support engineer for IXL's Auto-Rostering feature.

Our nightly sync service detected a large number of changes were made to your uploaded CSV files. As a precaution, we do not automatically process files that will cause greater than 10% changes to your IXL account.

These changes are from students being added or removed from the student roster, or for grade level changes for existing students.

If these changes are intended, please let me know and I would be happy to process the roster sync for your account.

Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help.

name: Auto-Rostering Kickoff 3
body:
My name is Roland Estrada, an IXL Support Engineer for our Auto-Rostering feature.

IXL's Auto-Rostering feature allows you to sync data from your SIS into your IXL account, effectively allowing you to manage your IXL students, teachers, and classes centrally from your SIS.

If you would like to move forward with the Auto-Rostering feature, please let me know and I will enable this for the account.

Before enabling Auto-Rostering, there are a few things I need to know from you:
  1. Who will be the main technical point of contact for Auto-Rostering? This person should:
    • Be able to manage user data in your SIS
    • Be able to manage an SFTP connection and data export
  2. The SIS you are using
  3. Your preferred SFTP username (optional)
    • This will be the username used for your SFTP connection
    • If you do not have a preference, IXL will randomly generate a four digit code to act as your SFTP username
  4. The data format you will use for your exports into IXL. This can be one of two formats:
    • The data format developed specifically for IXL, which can be found documented here: https://www.ixl.com/help_docs/IXL-Auto-Rostering-Specifications.pdf
    • IXL also supports the OneRoster v1.1 data format, which is documented here: https://www.imsglobal.org/oneroster-v11-final-csv-tables
  5. How to handle users already on your IXL account. These options will help your IXL account more closely match the data from your SIS, and will clean up previous years' teacher rosters.
    • Would you like us to archive any students not uploaded via Auto-Rostering?
    • Would you like us to archive any teachers not uploaded via Auto-Rostering?
    • Would you like us to archive any teacher rosters for any teachers uploaded via Auto-Rostering?
  6. Your first day of school
Once I know your main point of contact, as well as your preferences from the above questions, I can enable the Auto-Rostering feature for your account.

Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.

name: Failed by bundle overflow
body:
My name is Roland Estrada, and I am the support engineer for IXL's Auto-Rostering feature.

We received an alert that your account did not sync because the number of students on the account would exceed the number of licenses available.

I see that the account is currently using X of Y licenses. In the uploaded CSV I see Z students.

We do have the ability to match any existing users to the files we receive via SFTP, and remove any users already in the account that do not appear in the CSV files we receive.

If this is something you would like me to do, please let me know. Otherwise, you will need to reduce the number of users in your IXL account before we can process a successful Auto-Roster sync.

Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.

name: Auto-Rostering Template 2 kickoff
body:
*********** partial template *********

Once you have connected, you may upload your first set of data.

After the initial upload, I will audit the data along with a member of our development team. I will communicate any issues with the data to you.

Once the first set of data has been audited, we will cover additional options for preexisting data on your IXL account.

After that, we will perform the first sync manually.

After the first sync has been run, IXL will sync data nightly based on data uploaded by you to the SFTP site.

name: Switch to OneRoster data standard
body:
I will create an internal ticket with our development team to change the data standard for your account to accept the OneRoster v1.1 file format. I will let you know once this is done.

After this is completed, you can enter the SFTP information for IXL into ClassLink to perform the data export.

Once we have received the first upload, we match the new OneRoster data to the data on your account and perform a manual sync.

After that, we will sync any data we receive from ClassLink nightly.

I will follow up with you once our developers have changed the data standard for your account. Please let me know if you have any questions in the meantime.

name: Auto-Roster Manual Confirmation
body:
Thank you very much for the confirmation.

I have manually processed the Auto-Roster sync for your IXL account.

Please let me know if you have any questions, and I would be happy to assist.

name: Auto-Rostering ClassLink Kickoff 2
body:
My name is Roland Estrada, a Support Engineer for IXL.

To confirm, are you writing about the IXL account at the following link:

https://www.ixl.com/signin/customurl

I can enable the Auto-Rostering feature for this account. This will allow you to export ClassLink data in the OneRoster v1.1 file format to IXL through an SFTP connection.

I do not currently see your e-mail address associated with this IXL account. I will need to have either the primary or secondary contact on the account e-mail me authorizing me to grant you access to connect via SFTP.

The points of contact I have for this account are [CONTACT]. Please have either one e-mail me authorizing me to grant you access.

Once I have the verification, I can enable the Auto-Rostering integration which will generate an SFTP key that I can provide to you so that you can access the server to upload files.

Do you have a preferred SFTP username? If you do not have a preference, your username will be a randomly generated 4 digit code.

​Please let me know if you have any questions, and I will be happy to assist further.

name: Auto-Rostering ClassLink Kickoff
body:
My name is Roland Estrada, an IXL Support Engineer.

IXL's Auto-Rostering feature will let you sync data from your SIS into your IXL account, effectively allowing you to manage your IXL students, teachers, and classes centrally from your SIS.

IXL supports the OneRoster v1.1 file standard. With ClassLink, you can set up an SFTP connection to IXL and export your user and class data in the OneRoster v1.1 standard.

If you would like to move forward with the Auto-Rostering feature, please let me know and I will enable this for the account. Enabling the feature will generate an SFTP key that I can provide to you so that you can access the server to upload files.

Do you have a preferred SFTP username? If you do not have a preference, your username will be a randomly generated 4 digit code.

​Please let me know if you have any questions, and I will be happy to assist further.

name: SFTP Setup
body:
Dear NAME,

Thank you for your interest in auto-rostering! With auto-rostering your rosters will be updated on a nightly basis based on files sent to us through our SFTP server. Once we receive your initial files, we will begin the testing process. Since every file is different, the testing process may take up to two weeks.

When you are ready, you can upload your files to our SFTP server:

URL: sftp.ixl.com, port 22
Username: USERNAME

You can view your password by clicking the secure message link below. You'll only be able to access this link once before the message expires. Please save your new password somewhere secure after opening the message.

Click here to view your password: SECURELINK

Every set of files we receive is slightly different, so we’ll run a few tests once we receive your first upload. As soon as testing is complete, we’ll reach out to schedule nightly syncs.

Let me know when you've uploaded your files the SFTP, and our engineers will begin testing them.

name: Blank auto-roster
body:
Sincerely,
%NAME%
Customer Support Engineer

E-mail:
Phone:
Website: www.ixl.com

name: No Clever Auto-roster intro
greeting: Although IXL does not integrate with Clever's SSO or file standard, exporting your CSV files using our Auto-Rostering specifications sheet will let you sync data from your district's SIS into your IXL account.
body:
Although IXL does not integrate with Clever's SSO or file standard, exporting your CSV files using our auto-rostering specifications sheet will let you sync data from your district's SIS into your IXL account. This will allow you to manage your IXL students, teachers, and classes centrally from your SIS.

The following is a link to our Auto-Rostering Technical Specifications, which details the format we need your data to be in:

https://www.ixl.com/help_docs/IXL-Auto-Rostering-Specifications.pdf

Once your auto-roster integration is set up, we will send an SFTP username and secure password link, which you will use to export your files to IXL.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I'll be happy to help!

name: failed_by_num_changes blank
greeting: My name is %CSE%, and I am an IXL Support Engineer for our Auto-Rostering feature.
body:
We received an alert this morning that your account did not successfully sync overnight. I investigated the CSV files uploaded to our SFTP site, and I see that they are all blank. I wanted to verify with you that this is intentional.

If this is due to the summer season, I can pause the sync for your account.

If you would like to pause the sync for your account, please let me know the dates you would like to resume the sync. I recommend resuming the sync 1-2 weeks before the start of the fall school year to validate new roster changes early.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions, and I will be happy to assist.

name: failed_by_num_changes
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
My name is %CSE% and I am the support engineer for IXL's Auto-Rostering feature.

Our nightly sync service detected a large number of changes were made to your uploaded CSV files. As a precaution, we do not automatically process files that will cause greater than 10% changes to your IXL account.

Please let me know if these changes are intended, and I would be happy to process the roster sync for your account.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Google SSO High Level
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
At this time, IXL only supports SSO through Google Single Sign-On. To implement this, you must first have Google Identities set up for your users.

We are in the process of developing SAML support, and hope to have this released later this year.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!
tags: SSO, Sign-On, Sign On, SAML, LDAP

name: Google SSO Detailed
greeting: My name is %CSE%, and I am the Support Engineer for our SSO feature.
body:
We currently support SSO via Google Single Sign-On. To implement this, you must first have Google Identities set up for your users.

Next, please send us a list of e-mail domains used by your users in Google Identity. We will add this list of domains to your IXL account to validate incoming SSO requests.

Finally, ensure that the e-mail addresses of your IXL users match the e-mail addresses of their Google Identity.

After Google SSO is enabled for your account, your users will see a blue "Sign in with Google" button on your account's custom sign in page (%SIGNIN_URL%). When they click this link they will be prompted to sign in with their Google credentials. IXL will match their Google Identity e-mail to their IXL e-mail, and your users will be signed in.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions, and I will be happy to assist.
